messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On June 8, DET. T. U. Vaughn responded to a series of graffiti tags in Westbridge Park. Principal informants were Mr. Peterson, a park ranger, and Ms. White, a local resident. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. V. W. Grant - OPERATIONS Det. Vaughn, Jr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. Detective X. Y. Dixon and Detective Z. A. Ellis arrived to assess the damage. CARTER 13:15 Graffiti Mr. Peterson discovered fresh paint on monuments, and Ms. White mentioned a group of teenagers the previous night. Spray. Technician Sam collected paint samples. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Vaughn Jr, Det. Dixon, Det. Ellis OPERATIONS Lt. Grant INFORMANT White, Jessica 92 Willow Way, Westbridge, California 174-685. 93490. CARTER 13:15 Graffiti By 3:40 PM, Detectives Vaughn, Dixon, and Ellis, with Lieutenant Grant's guidance, identified potential tags from a known local group. Captain B. C. Hunter suggested surveillance for recurring activity. Sergeant D. E. Flynn and Sergeant F. G. Gordon conducted interviews with known taggers. By 5:10 PM, leads pointed to a particular group. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Vaughn Jr, Det. Dixon, Det. Ellis OPERATIONS Lt. Grant AFFIDAVIT - Graffiti Report 1) Park Maintenance Logs 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) Photographs of Tags 5) Park CCTV (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE H. Anderson W.P.P.D. 23.80 P56 2570 Peterson, MARK NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 145-2872 DETECTIVE: T. VAUGHN ITEM: 56-5100- 100 CRIME: 13:15 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 83155 - CONFIRMED John Doe DATE 12/30/23 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. T. U. Vaughn  Officer Context: Responded to graffiti tags in Westbridge Park on June 8. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. V. W. Grant  Officer Context: Referred in the context of OPERATIONS. Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective X. Y. Dixon  Officer Context: Arrived to assess the graffiti damage with Detective Z. A. Ellis. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Z. A. Ellis  Officer Context: Arrived to assess the graffiti damage with Detective X. Y. Dixon. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Sam  Officer Context: Collected paint samples from the graffiti. Officer Role: Technician Officer Name: Detective Vaughn  Officer Context: Identified potential graffiti tags from a known local group by 3:40 PM. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Dixon  Officer Context: Identified potential graffiti tags from a known local group by 3:40 PM. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Ellis  Officer Context: Identified potential graffiti tags from a known local group by 3:40 PM. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain B. C. Hunter  Officer Context: Suggested surveillance for recurring graffiti activity. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant D. E. Flynn  Officer Context: Conducted interviews with known taggers. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant F. G. Gordon  Officer Context: Conducted interviews with known taggers. Officer Role: Sergeant
